newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS -- Issues to watch -- March 4.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS -- Issues to watch -- March 4.

text.p: * Microsoft Corp shares dropped 5/8 in after-hours trading Monday following a two-point rise during the regular session. Microsoft traded at 98-7/8, down from 99-1/2 at the close.
* Shares of U.S. oil drilling companies were firm in London. Baker Hughes Inc was up 1/4 at 35, Schlumberger Ltd was up 1/4 at 98-3/4, and Halliburton Co climbed 1/4 to 62.
* Norfolk Southern Corp may pay CSX Corp $4.2 billion as part of a tentative pact to end their lengthy takeover battle for Conrail Inc, the Wall Street Journal said.
The report said a tentative agreement calls for CSX to then raise its offer for Conrail by $1 billion, thereby matching Norfolk Southern's $10.3 billion hostile offer for Conrail.
Norfolk Southern closed at 93-7/8. CSX closed at 49. Conrail closed at 111-5/8.
